sourceMeaningMnemonic: You put a <radical>cross</radical> in the <radical>mouth</radical> of a <radical>wolverine</radical>. What a strange <kanji>action</kanji>. Why would you do such a <kanji>thing</kanji>? The fact of the <kanji>matter</kanji> is that you're not too sure why you put that cross in the wolverine's mouth.
meaningInfo: Imagine that poor wolverine standing in front of you looking confused, with a cross in its mouth.
readingMnemonic: This action doesn't impress <reading>Je</reading>sus (<ja>じ</ja>), who appears and gently removes the cross from the wolverine's mouth.
readingInfo: Imagine Jesus gently taking the cross out of the wolverine's mouth. What a swell dude.
